senses.de: The state or level of quality that someone or something is in.
senses.ex: The car is in good condition.

Tips.title: Usage Frequency
Tips.description: Commonly used to describe objects' or places' quality, often seen in ads or reviews.
Tips.example: The apartment is in excellent condition, ready for new tenants.

Tips.title: Emotional Connotation
Tips.description: Can express pride or dissatisfaction when talking about possessions.
Tips.example: He keeps his collection in pristine condition.

Tips.title: Not Always Physical
Tips.description: Might refer to abstract qualities, such as reputation or situations.
Tips.example: The company's condition improved after the merger.

senses.de: A rule or demand that must be met.
senses.ex: He agreed to the conditions of the contract.

Tips.title: Mandatory Aspect
Tips.description: Stresses that certain rules or requirements are necessary and often non-negotiable.
Tips.example: Access to the event is granted under the condition of full identification.

Tips.title: Conditional Agreement
Tips.description: Used when agreeing to do something only if specific demands are met first.
Tips.example: I'll lend you the money on the condition that you pay it back within a month.

senses.de: To control or influence the behavior or development of something.
senses.ex: She conditions her hair with a special cream.

Tips.title: Improvement Process
Tips.description: Refers to making something better or preparing it for a specific situation or use.
Tips.example: Athletes condition themselves before a big competition.

Tips.title: Continuous Action
Tips.description: Implies a regular, ongoing process rather than a one-time event.
Tips.example: The leather of the new shoes needs to be conditioned regularly.

Tips.title: Health Context
Tips.description: Used medically to refer to both temporary and chronic health issues.
Tips.example: Doctors diagnosed her symptoms as a neurological condition.

Tips.title: Sensitivity
Tips.description: When related to health, it should be used with care due to personal and emotional impact.
Tips.example: Talking about someone's medical condition requires sensitivity.

senses.de: A premise on which the fulfillment of something depends.
senses.ex: This clause contains a condition precedent.

Tips.title: Legal Specificity
Tips.description: In legal contexts, it refers to specific and formal requirements in agreements.
Tips.example: Failure to meet the condition may void the contract.

Tips.title: Binding Language
Tips.description: Terms like 'condition precedent' are legally binding and have precise consequences.
Tips.example: The insurance payout is subject to a condition of timely premium payment.

Circumstance.wordDefinition:
Circumstance refers to a fact or event that surrounds a situation, while the word condition refers to a state that something or someone is in.

Circumstance is often used to describe external factors that affect a situation, while condition is more likely to be used to describe an internal characteristic.

For example, a circumstance may be the weather conditions, the time of day, or the location of an event.

However, circumstance is often used when discussing events or situations that are outside of our control, while condition is generally used in situations where the subject is something that can be changed or improved.

Circumstance describes external facts or events affecting a situation, while condition refers to the state of something or someone.

Fit.wordDefinition:
Fit generally refers to physical fitness or suitability for a specific purpose. It is applicable when referring to someone's physical fitness level or whether an object or person is suitable for a particular task, job, or situation.

Condition relates to the state or quality of something, while fit relates to physical fitness or suitability for a specific purpose.

Health.wordDefinition:
Health generally refers to the overall state of well-being, which encompasses physical, mental, and emotional aspects. It is a broader term than condition and implies that all aspects of a person's life are functioning optimally.

Health can also include preventative measures, such as eating a healthy diet and exercising regularly, to maintain this state of well-being.

Condition is more specific and refers to a particular ailment, while health is a broader concept encompassing overall well-being.

Position.wordDefinition:
Position refers to the location or placement of something or someone in relation to other things or people.

It can also refer to someone's status, role or rank. For example, if a person is sitting in a certain spot, their position may be described as "sitting at the table" or "sitting next to John".

Position can be applicable in a variety of contexts, such as discussing the position of a team in a sports league, the position of a company in the market, or the position of someone within an organization.

Condition refers to the state of something, while position refers to its location or rank.

Predicament.wordDefinition:
Condition refers to the physical or mental state of something or someone, while predicament refers to a difficult or unpleasant situation that is difficult to solve.

For example, if someone has a medical condition, it means they have a specific health issue or illness. If someone is in a predicament, it means they are in a tough situation, like being stuck in a locked room or dealing with a difficult problem.

Condition is applicable when referring to someone's health or the state of something, whereas predicament is applicable in reference to difficult situations that someone might find themselves in.

Requirement.wordDefinition:
A requirement refers to something that is necessary or mandatory for a particular purpose. For example, "meeting the minimum age requirement before getting a driver's license.".

In simpler terms, a condition is a specific factor that must be fulfilled to achieve a certain goal, while a requirement is a general rule that must be followed to meet a particular standard.

Situation.wordDefinition:
Condition generally refers to a physical or mental state, while situation refers to the circumstances or surroundings. For example, a person's medical condition might be bad or good, while a situation could be a problem or opportunity.

Condition is used when referring to someone's health, while situation is used when describing a set of circumstances.

State.wordDefinition:
Condition refers to the physical or mental health of a person or thing, whereas the word state refers to the overall situation or circumstances surrounding something.

If we talk about the state of the economy, we are referring to the overall economic climate of a particular country or region.

Condition is used more specifically to refer to the health or wellbeing of an individual or thing, while state is more broad and can be used to discuss a variety of circumstances or situations.

Status.wordDefinition:
Status refers to the position or standing of someone or something in relation to others. For example, a person can have a high social status due to their wealth or job, or a product can have a high status due to its brand name.

Condition refers to the current state of something, while status refers to its position or standing in a larger context.

quotes.Text: If I am against the condition of the world, it is not because I am a moralist - it is because I want to laugh more.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Henry Miller

quotes.Text: If you live only in one culture for the first 20 years of your life, you become conditioned without knowing it.
quotes.Title: German Speaker
quotes.Name: Eckhart Tolle

quotes.Text: No one would choose a friendless existence on condition of having all the other things in the world.
quotes.Title: Greek Philosopher
quotes.Name: Aristotle

quotes.Text: West Virginians should be protected against preexisting conditions.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Jim Justice

quotes.Text: I get paid to do what I enjoy, not that common a condition.
quotes.Title: Welsh Editor
quotes.Name: Ian Hislop

quotes.Text: I am angry about the world's conditions for black people.
quotes.Title: South African Musician
quotes.Name: Brenda Fassie

quotes.Text: The condition of the wounded touched my heart deeply.
quotes.Title: South African Politician
quotes.Name: Christiaan Rudolf de Wet

quotes.Text: Conditioning is the most important thing in MMA.
quotes.Title: Croatian Athlete
quotes.Name: Mirko Cro Cop

quotes.Text: The lie is a condition of life.
quotes.Title: German Philosopher
quotes.Name: Friedrich Nietzsche
